title: Government Shutdown That May Lead to Mass Layoffs Begins
summary: Government funding was cut off shortly after midnight in a spending deadlock that could cut essential services and lead to mass layoffs.

title: What Are the Effects of a Government Shutdown?
summary: Ben Casselman, the chief economics correspondent for The New York Times, describes the economic effects of a government shutdown.

title: Democrats See No Need to Capitulate, Nor Republicans to Cut a Deal
summary: The last time Senate Democrats found themselves taking the blame for a government shutdown, they quickly caved. That’s less likely to happen now.

title: How a Government Shutdown Will Affect Social Security
summary: Retirement, survivor and disability payments will continue, but some services may be temporarily unavailable.

title: U.S. Shutdown Begins, and Trump Tells Military to Use U.S. Cities as ‘Training Grounds’
summary: Plus, Italian grandmothers’ secret weapon.

title: Moscow Indicates Retaliation if Europe Uses Russian Assets for Ukraine
summary: Amid a plan to lend $165 billion to Kyiv using Russian state assets, European officials are mindful of the possibility of blowback as they gather to discuss the idea.

title: What Is Europe’s ‘Drone Wall’?
summary: The European Union is talking about shoring up defenses in its eastern airspace. Recent Russian drone incursions have lent urgency to the project.

title: Trump Gave the Military’s Brass a Rehashed Speech. Until Minute 44.
summary: On an almost daily basis, thousands of words pour forth from the president’s mouth. Sometimes, he tucks in a wildly revealing insight about the direction he is taking the country.

title: Hegseth Lectures Military Brass on ‘Woke’ Leaders, Fitness and Grooming
summary: Senior officers, summoned from around the world, are entrusted to manage complex military operations. They got a lecture on fitness and grooming standards.

title: The $400 Million Restaurant Man
summary: Stephen Starr has become one of America’s most successful restaurateurs, making and replicating dining magic at places like Pastis and Osteria Mozza.

title: White House Withdraws Nomination of E.J. Antoni, Trump’s Pick to Lead BLS
summary: E.J. Antoni, a conservative economist, had faced bipartisan criticism as President Trump’s nominee to lead the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Judge Disqualifies Nevada’s Acting U.S. Attorney From Handling Cases
summary: A federal judge said Sigal Chattah was not “validly serving as acting U.S. attorney.” The Trump administration had appointed her to the post in a way that circumvented federal procedures.

title: Should the Autism Spectrum Be Split Apart?
summary: Families of people with severe autism say the repeated expansion of the diagnosis pushed them to the sidelines. A new focus on the disorder has opened the way for them to argue their cause.

title: Did a Green Beret Unit Commit One of the Worst U.S. War Crimes in Decades?
summary: In 2012, after a team member was nearly killed, a Special Forces unit went on a rampage that might have been one of the worst war crimes in recent U.S. history.

title: Inside the U.S. Special Forces: 5 Takeaways on a Culture of Lawlessness in Afghanistan
summary: Until now, many of the troubling events that took place during the war in Afghanistan have been shrouded in secrecy.

title: China Displays Its Gizmos and Ambition, but Fewer Answers on Trade
summary: The vast Global Digital Trade Expo in Hangzhou stood as a rebuke to U.S. efforts to hem in China’s technology. But the real competition is internal, and profits are hard to find.

title: The Race to Figure Out Why More Young People Are Getting Cancer
summary: In the last decade, more than a dozen types of cancer have risen among people under 50. Scientists don’t have all of the answers, but research is starting to offer clues.

title: Tell us about your experience with early-onset cancer.
summary: We want to hear your stories of living with cancer as a younger adult.

title: What to Know Before Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’s Sentencing
summary: The music mogul will be in court on Friday when a judge is scheduled to announce Mr. Combs’s penalty for convictions on two prostitution-related offenses.

title: She Turned the World On With Her Smile. But Where Will the Hat Live?
summary: Mary Tyler Moore’s piece of television history seeks a permanent home.

title: The Real Stakes of the Shutdown
summary: President Trump is seeking to deprive millions of Americans of their health insurance. Senate Democrats are refusing to acquiesce.

title: Is James Talarico the Answer to Democratic Prayers?
summary: James Talarico sees a spiritual void at the center of our society.

title: The Federal Government Shut Down Overnight
summary: We also look at a gathering of generals in Washington.

title: Ronny Chieng Shades Pete Hegseth’s Military Address
summary: “Listen, we all do weird things when we’re drunk, OK?" Chieng said. “Some of us slide into an ex’s DMs, and some of us call every U.S. general to a meeting at Quantico.”

title: Oktoberfest Closed Because of Bomb Threat in Munich
summary: The German authorities said the rare decision was taken after an earlier explosion in a residential area of the city.

title: Can This Japanese City Make Residents Put Down Their Smartphones?
summary: The authorities in Toyoake, Japan, introduced a rule limiting the use of digital devices to two hours per day outside of work and school. Some residents say it is an overreach.

title: Kimmel and Colbert, Joined in New York, Show a United Front
summary: The two late-night hosts shared stories on each other’s shows on Tuesday about their recent turmoil, and some criticism of President Trump.

title: Earthquake in Philippines Kills Dozens, Officials Say
summary: The 6.9-magnitude earthquake shook the province of Cebu, killing at least 69 people and injuring more than 150. Heavy rainfall has hampered rescue efforts.
